ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Check that no unauthenticated repository is authorized by configuration
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Accessing a repository should be allowed only when the repository is authenticated.

ns3:criteria.comment: Detect any usage of allow-ynauthenticated option

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

ns3:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

ns3:criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: SNMP default communities disabled
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: SNMP use newer protocols
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Disable Compression Or Set Compression to delayed
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for parameter 'Compression' with value '(no|delayed)' in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

ns3:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns3:criterion.comment: Check the absence of Compression in /etc/ssh/sshd_config

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

ns3:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns3:criteria.comment: SSH version is equal or higher than 7.4 has deprecated RhostsRSAAuthentication

ns3:extend_definition.comment: OpenSSH version 7.4 or higher has deprecated RhostsRSAAuthentication

ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

ns3:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

ns3:criteria.comment: SSH is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set OpenSSH authentication attempt limit (MaxAuthTries)
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The SSH MaxAuthTries should be set to an appropriate value.

ns3:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Rule title of sshd_use_priv_separation
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for parameter 'UsePrivilegeSeparation' with value 'sandbox' in '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

ns3:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

ns3:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix with either sufficient or default=ignore
Perform check if pam_faillock authfail follows pam_unix even with lines skipped
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

ns3:criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

ns3:criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

ns3:criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

ns3:criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

ns3:criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

ns3:criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

ns3:criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

ns3:criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

ns3:criteria.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns3:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Configure audispd Plugin Remote Server IP address or Hostname
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: remote_server setting in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf is set to a certain IP address or hostname

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Kerberos 5 Authentication and Encryption in Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: enable_krb5 setting in /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf is set to 'yes'

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Errors
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: disk_error_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Is Full
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: disk_full_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Configure auditd space_left on Low Disk Space
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: space_left setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify the UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg Group Owner
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Verify that UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg is group owned by 0.

ns3:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is not UEFI

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Group Owner
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Verify that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg is group owned by gid 0.

ns3:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify the UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg Owner
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Verify that UEFI Boot Loader grub.cfg is owned by uid 0.

ns3:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is not UEFI

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Owner
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Verify that /boot/grub2/grub.cfg is owned by uid 0.

ns3:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /boot/grub2/grub.cfg Mode Permissions
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: File permissions for /boot/grub2/grub.cfg should be set to 0600 (or stronger).

ns3:extend_definition.comment: Pass if system boot mode is UEFI

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Force IOMMU usage in GRUB2
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for argument iommu=force in the kernel line in /etc/default/grub.

ns3:criterion.comment: check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Ensure the logrotate utility performs the automatic rotation of log files on daily basis
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The frequency of automatic log files rotation performed by the logrotate utility should be configured to run daily

ns3:criteria.comment: /etc/logrotate.conf contains daily setting and /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists

ns3:criterion.comment: Check if daily is set in /etc/logrotate.conf
Check if /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file exists (and calls logrotate)

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Send Logs to a Remote Loghost
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Syslog logs should be sent to a remote loghost

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Disable IPv6 Kernel Module Functionality via Disable Option
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The disable option will allow the IPv6 module to be inserted, but prevent address assignment and activation of the network stack.

ns3:criterion.comment: ipv6 disabled any modprobe conf file

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify that System.map files are readable only by root
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Checks that /boot/System.map-* are only readable by root.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

ns3:criterion.comment: Ensure /var/tmp is configured to bind mount to /tmp
Ensure /var/tmp and /tmp have the same source device

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Disable core dump backtraces
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for parameter 'ProcessSizeMax' with value '(?i)0(?-i)' in section 'Coredump' in '/etc/systemd/coredump.conf'

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Disable storing core dump
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for parameter 'Storage' with value '(?i)none(?-i)' in section 'Coredump' in '/etc/systemd/coredump.conf'

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Harden SSHD Crypto Policy
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: Look for parameter 'CRYPTO_POLICY' with value ''-oCiphers=aes128-ctr,aes256-ctr,aes128-cbc,aes256-cbc -oMACs=hmac-sha2-256,hmac-sha2-512 -oGSSAPIKeyExchange=no -oKexAlgorithms=diffie-hellman-group14-sha1,ecdh-sha2-nistp256,ecdh-sha2-nistp384,ecdh-sha2-nistp521 -oHostKeyAlgorithms=rsa-sha2-256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com,rsa-sha2-512,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521,ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com -oPubkeyAcceptedKeyTypes=ssh-rsa,ecdsa-sha2-nistp256,ecdsa-sha2-nistp384'' in '/etc/crypto-policies/back-ends/opensshserver.config'

ns3:criteria.comment: sshd is configured correctly or is not installed

ns3:extend_definition.comment: sshd is not required or requirement is unset
sshd is required or requirement is unset

ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group is group owned by 0.

ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group is owned by 0.

ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/group has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/gshadow has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /etc/passwd Mode Permissions
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/passwd has mode 0644. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Verify /etc/shadow Mode Permissions
ns3:metadata.ns3:description: This test makes sure that /etc/shadow has mode 0640. If the target file or directory has an extended ACL, then it will fail the mode check.

ns3:metadata.ns3:title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition

ns6:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf
Checks usage of unauthenticated in apt.conf.d/*
Tests the value of the insecure locks in /etc/exports
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab
tests the value of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the absence of Compression setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the RhostsRSAAuthentication[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of UsePrivilegeSeparation setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Checks if pam_faillock authfail is hit even if pam_unix skips lines by defaulting, and also authfail deny value
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present, with correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix.
Check control values of pam_unix, that it is followed by pam_faillock.so authfail and deny value of pam_faillock.so authfail
Check if pam_faillock.so is called in account phase before pam_unix
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth, has correct deny value, and is followed by pam_unix
Check pam_faillock authfail is present after pam_unix, check pam_unix has proper control values, and authfail deny value is correct.
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase before pam_unix.

ns6:variable_test.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd
The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_LEN should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_WARN_AGE should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns6:textfilecontent54_test.comment: make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns6:variable_test.comment: <0, UID_MIN - 1> system UIDs having shell set
<0, SYS_UID_MIN> system UIDs having shell set
<SYS_UID_MIN, SYS_UID_MAX> system UIDS having shell set

ns7:file_test.comment: Check if there aren't directories in root's path having write permission set for group or other

ns6:textfilecontent54_test.comment: remote server to send audit records
check for iommu=force in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX
check for fips=1 in /etc/default/grub via GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT
Tests the presence of daily setting in /etc/logrotate.conf file
Tests the existence of /etc/cron.daily/logrotate file (and verify it actually calls logrotate utility)
Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host
Ensures system configured to export logs to remote host
ipv6 disabled any modprobe conf file

ns7:file_test.comment: system.map files readable only by root
